tic_tac_toe.title: Tic Tac Toe
tic_tac_toe.objective_text: The first player to align 3 consecutive pieces (horizontally, vertically, or diagonally) wins the game.
tic_tac_toe.pieces_text: Each player has a piece with a distinct color and symbol.
tic_tac_toe.rule1: Players take turns making one move, placing their piece on any empty cell.
tic_tac_toe.rule2: The game continues until a player aligns 3 consecutive pieces, or the board is completely full, resulting in a tie.
tic_tac_toe.end_game_text: The game ends when a player aligns 3 pieces, declaring them the winner by their chosen color. In case of a tie, players may restart the game or exit.

connect4_game.title: Connect 4
connect4_game.objective_text: The first player to align 4 consecutive pieces (horizontally, vertically, or diagonally) wins the game.
connect4_game.board_text: The board is a vertical grid with 7 columns and 6 rows. Pieces are dropped into the columns and fall to the lowest available space.
connect4_game.pieces_text: Each player has a set of pieces in a distinct color (usually red and yellow).
connect4_game.rule1: Players take turns making one move by dropping their piece into any column.
connect4_game.rule2: The piece falls into the lowest available position in the column. The game continues until a player aligns 4 consecutive pieces, or the board is full, resulting in a tie.
connect4_game.end_game_text: The game ends when a player aligns 4 pieces, declaring them the winner by their chosen color. In case of a tie, players may restart the game or exit.

project_opening.title: Project: HEIL Games 4 Development for Web
project_opening.overview_text: The goal of this project is to develop an online version of the classic Connect 4 game, allowing players to compete in a digital environment.
project_opening.objective1: Develop an online version of Connect 4 for web browsers.
project_opening.objective2: Allow human players to compete in real time.
project_opening.objective3: Ensure an intuitive and responsive interface for a pleasant gaming experience.
project_opening.scope_text: The project scope includes the development of both front-end and back-end necessary for the game operation.
project_opening.budget_text: The estimated budget for the project is R$ 100,000.
project_opening.schedule_text: The project is expected to last for 8 hours, with the following key phases:
project_opening.approval_text: By signing below, the Sponsor formally approves the start of the project as described in this document.

RF_001.TITLE: RF-001: Game Board Display
RF_001.DESCRIPTION: The system must display the game board to the players, which should have 7 columns with 6 rows.

RF_002.TITLE: RF-002: Number of Players
RF_002.DESCRIPTION: Each match must have exactly 2 players.

RF_003.TITLE: RF-003: Player Differentiation
RF_003.DESCRIPTION: Each player will have a specific color for their game pieces.

RF_004.TITLE: RF-004: Piece Control
RF_004.DESCRIPTION: Each player plays with 21 pieces and will only control the pieces belonging to the color they chose.

RF_005.TITLE: RF-005: Piece Placement
RF_005.DESCRIPTION: The goal of the match is to connect 4 pieces, which can be aligned horizontally, vertically, or diagonally.

RF_006.TITLE: RF-006: Victory Identifier
RF_006.DESCRIPTION: Once a player connects 4 pieces, the system identifies and declares the winner based on the color of the pieces.

RF_007.TITLE: RF-007: End of Game
RF_007.DESCRIPTION: After declaring the winner, the system must stop the game and prompt the players with a confirmation box to restart another match.

RF_008.TITLE: RF-008: Game Start and Restart
RF_008.DESCRIPTION: The system must randomly select which player will start or restart the game.

RF_009.TITLE: RF-009: 5 Color/Figure Choices
RF_009.DESCRIPTION: The system must offer a selection of 5 colors/figures for the player to choose for their pieces.

RF_010.TITLE: RF-010: Option for 3 Languages
RF_010.DESCRIPTION: The system must allow the player to select from up to 3 languages.

RF_011.TITLE: RF-011: Player vs Computer Interaction
RF_011.DESCRIPTION: The system must have the option for the player to also play against the computer.

NF_001.TITLE: NF-001: User Interface
NF_001.DESCRIPTION: The interface should be intuitive and easy to use, with clear instructions for new players on the game rules and functionality.

NF_002.TITLE: NF-002: Visual Feedback
NF_002.DESCRIPTION: The system must provide accessible and effective feedback for actions and notifications about the moves, game state, victories, or ties.

NF_003.TITLE: NF-003: Response Time
NF_003.DESCRIPTION: The system must ensure that player actions are processed and reflected on the screen in under 2 seconds.
NF_003.RESPONSE: the response time is directly related to how quickly the board is displayed to the player.

NF_004.TITLE: NF-004: Accessibility
NF_004.DESCRIPTION: The system must allow interaction using a mouse.

NF_005.TITLE: NF-005: Victory Announcement
NF_005.DESCRIPTION: The system must visually announce the victory, providing clear information about the winner.
